Entries.default:
One of the kith looks up to you.

If a person can be described as 'looking' without eyes.
"Do not interfere with the work of the Archives, and its librarians will not interfere with you."
"These are the Archives. The accumulated lore of those who See without being Seen."
"Furthermore, the Oracle has limited patron admittance to the lower levels only. Trespassers in the upper floors will face reprisals."
"Two unidentified individuals roam the Archives. They will be dealt with accordingly."
"For your safety, please avoid the eastern stacks. They have been contaminated."
"Hello."
"You seem to have misplaced your eyes."
"What is this place?"
"What a fantastic collection of books you've gathered."

"Do not remove the books from the shelves."

The man's voice plods emotionlessly forward, as if he is heavily sedated.
"Lest you face reprisal."
"Don't steal your books, got it."
"See without being seen? I see you now. And you have no eyes."
"Any other rules I should know about?"
"It is remarkable, isn't it?"
"What is this place?"
"Reprisals, huh? You think you can take me?"
"These are the Archives," he repeats. "The accumulated lore of those who See without being Seen."
"Bet we could just push them over."
"Reprisals will be swift and uncompromising. So demands the Oracle of Wael."

He doesn't respond, save to stare blankly at you.

Or not stare, exactly.
"Kinda feels like he'd be blinking at you. If he had eyes to blink."
"Don't steal your books. Don't go upstairs. Anything else I should know?"
"I would never dream of going somewhere uninvited."
"Has anyone else been through here recently? Maybe someone with tentacles?"
[Nod.]
"Don't steal books. Don't go upstairs. Don't go east. Understood."
"Contaminated?"
[Leave] "Thanks."
"Sure gotta lot of don't's, don't they?"

"Please keep further conversation to a minimum."

The figure nods his eyeless head and turns away, returning to his work.
"The contamination will be remedied within five to fifteen years."
"Real friendly sorts." He rubs the back of his head and shrugs.
"Chatty as a keel-hauled corpse, ain't he?"
"The Oracle sees all."
"Did the people you're cleaning up not follow the rules?"
"Not at all. These Librarians were retired by an intruder wearing a mask."
"Was this masked intruder a tall woman? Maybe named Maura?"
"Retired?"
"We believe the individual to be a misplaced specimen from the Collections."
"Both intruders have entered the Quarantined Section to the east. We have not pursued, as that section is under quarantine."
Robed figures unflinchingly clean thick gore from the stone floors.
"I am afraid not. A woman matching that description did ask access to the vault, however. We did not grant her request."
"Rendered incapable of performing their duties. The intruder possessed both an advanced aptitude with wizardry and thorough understanding of the security apparatus of the Archives."
"I do not believe the swish-y things are meant to clean up blood."
"'Swish-y thing' - do you mean a broom?"
"Yes, 'broom!' That is the word. Broom, broom, broom. Broooom."
"Heh, it does not sound like a word anymore."
"It be a broom, lad."
"Well, Aloth might have some trouble."

"The laddie's able enough when it counts, Ed√©r." Iselmyr's eyebrows dance suggestively. She sinks back below the sea of Aloth's mind with a dry chuckle.

When Aloth resurfaces, a furious blush colors his cheeks.
"I would never disrespect a librarian in such a manner!"
